data.name: Javascript
data.description: I have programmed in JavaScript for over 8 years freelancing, 3 years working with enterprise level software. I have expert familiarity with the JavaScript ecosystem, ranging from scaling out distributed frontends to full REST Node backends.

data.name: TypeScript
data.description: I've led and taught company-wide classes in adopting TypeScript into an existing codebase. Where there has been a need for a type system, I have been able to provide a solution.

data.name: NodeJS
data.description: From building out full REST APIs to building out CLI tools, I have experience with NodeJS in a variety of contexts. I possess a deep familiarity with working on Node servers, and degbugging problems in the event loop.

data.name: Swift
data.description: When building out React Native mobile apps, I have used Swift to build out the native solutions that could not be solved through limitations in JavaScript.

data.name: Kotlin
data.description: Like Swift, I have used Kotlin to build out native solutions for React Native mobile apps. This has grown my understanding not only of Java, but also the Android ecosystem.

data.name: Rust
data.description: My newest passion, I've taken my first foray into Rust to contribute to a number of game dev projects. Like any programmer alive, I'm excited to hit the ground running with Rust.

data.name: Sass
data.description: I have used Sass on an enterprise level, and a deep understanding of the Sass ecosystem. I have helped dramatically reduce the size of company CSS workloads by implementing modular systems.

data.name: Sequelize
data.description: My ORM of choice when working with a SQL database. I have used Seqeulize to work with enterprise datasets with entries in the tens of millions.

data.name: Mongoose
data.description: My personal favorite ORM for working on small projects and prototypes, and when I feel like relating data is going to be a headache.

data.name: Material UI
data.description: MUI has been my favorite component library for a long time. I have used it in all of my enterpise experience and in all of my personal web projects.

data.name: Webpack
data.description: Professionally I have used webpack to build out distributed systems, and personally I have used it to build out my own deployed monorepo projects.

data.name: Express
data.description: Utilizing Express, I have built out terse, dynamic REST routes and scaled them out to handle millions of requests per day.

data.name: Docker
data.description: Docker has been my tech of choice for my own homelab containerization, as well as my preferred means of deploying services to the cloud.

data.name: Azure
data.description: My favorite of the cloud providers, I have used Azure to deploy a number of services, including a full CI/CD pipeline for a most of my web apps.

data.name: Linux
data.description: Using Ubuntu 20.04, I maintain a very robust homelab that I use to host a number of services, including my own personal databases that serve data to my apps.

data.name: Git
data.description: Full understanding of collaborative git workflows, including branching, merging, and rebasing. I have used git to manage a number of large projects.

data.name: Command Line
data.description: Familiarity with the command line, including bash scripting, and the ability to use the command line to solve problems.

data.name: React
data.description: The main frontend framework I use personally and professionally. My deepest expertise, aside from JavaScript, is in React.

data.name: React-Native
data.description: Utilizing my knowledge of React, I have built out mobile apps for both iOS and Android. I have experience with both Expo and React-Native CLI.

data.name: Angular
data.description: Don't get too excited, this is unfortunately experience in AngularJS, not modern Angular. My proudest Angular experience is in migrating it to a React app.

data.name: Expo
data.description: My favorite framwork for React Native, Expo is my favroite tool for compiling Android / IOS apps and dpeloying them to the app stores.

data.name: Macroquad
data.description: Used in tandem with Rust, I am collaborating on 2D games using Macroquad, along with engaging in its vibrant community.

data.name: PostgreSQL
data.description: The best SQL language, let's be honest. The database I have used most professionally, I have used it to build out large, distributed systems.

data.name: MySQL
data.description: The SQL dialect I learned in school, used to build out several school projects and a few personal projects.

data.name: MongoDB
data.description: My personal favorite database for small projects and prototypes. The one I use the least, but my favorite for its speed and ease of use.

data.name: Dwarf Fortress
data.description: This game has eaten away more hours of my life than anything on the planet. I love building giant sandcastles and watching my dwarves crumble with them. STRIKE THE EARTH!

data.name: Biking
data.description: There's nothing better than hitting a bike trail in the height of summer.

data.name: Hiking
data.description: I love the natural beauty around the PNW - getting out to see it is one of my favorite things to do.

data.name: Paleontology
data.description: I'm a huge natrual history nerd. My favorite era is the Cretaceous, and I can talk for hours about the Pleistocene mammals.

data.name: Gaming
data.description: I've been a video game junky since I could crawl. From NES all the way to modern systems. My favorite leisure activity.

data.name: Embarrassing my Teenage Daughter
data.description: This isn't just my hobby, it's my superpower. I am the best at it, and no one on earth can do it better.
